question: After a 26-year-old man's car was roadsided by a large truck, he is brought to the emergency depament with multiple fractures of the transverse processes of the cervical and upper thoracic veebrae. Which of the following muscles might be affected?
exp: The Levator Scapulae arise from the transverse processes of the Upper Cervical Veebrae and inses on the medial border of the Scapula. The other muscles are attached to the Spinous Processes of the Veebrae.

question: A 44-year-old woman comes to her physician and complains of headache and backache. On examination, she is found to have fluid accumulated in the spinal epidural space because of damage to blood vessels or meninges. Which of the following structures is most likely ruptured?
exp: The Internal Veebral Venous Plexus is located in the spinal epidural space. The veebral aery and vein occupy the transverse foramina of the upper six cervical veebrae. The external veebral venous plexus consists of the anterior pa, which lies in front of the veebral column, and the posterior pa, which lies on the veebral arch. The lumbar cistern is the enlargement of the subarachnoid space between the inferior end of the spinal cord and the inferior end of the subarachnoid space.

question: Burning sensation in middle finger Triceps Reflex is weak Slip disc?
exp: HERNIATED DISC B/W COMPRESSED NERVE ROOT DERMATOME AFFECTED MUSCLES AFFECTED MOVEMENT WEAKNESS NERVE AND REFLEX INVOLVED C6 and C7 C7 C7 middle finger Triceps wrist extensors extension of forearm extension of wrist radial nerve | triceps jerk

question: Which of these pas of Veebral Canal will show secondary curves with concavity backwards
exp: Fetus - universal flexion - 1deg curvature After bih - Cervical Lordosis - 2deg curvature begins when child stas to gain head stability lumbar lordosis - convex anteriorly begins to appear when child learns to sit. Cervical lordosis - 2deg Thoracic kyphosis - 1deg Lumbar lordosis - 2deg Sacral kyphosis - 1deg

question: Dislocation of the veebra is uncommon in thoracic region because in this region
exp: The superior aicular process is directed backward, upward and laterally (BUL) in the thoracic region. It interlocks with the corresponding inferior aicular facet making a strong aiculation rendering dislocation in the thoracic region uncommon.
opd: Spinous process is long and pointed

question: All of the following characteristics differentiate a typical cervical veebra from a thoracic veebra EXCEPT:
exp: Superior aicular facets are directed backwards & upwards in both cervical and thoracic regions, henceis not a differentiating feature. Veebral body is the smallest in the cervical region. Large veebral body is present at the level of lumbar veebra. Veebral foramen is triangular and large in the cervical veebra. The foramen is small and circular in thoracic veebra. Cervical veebrae are identified by the foramen transversarium in their transverse process.
opc: Superior aicular facet is directed backwards & upwards

question: A 25-year-old soldier suffers a gunshot wound on the lower pa of his back and is unable to move his legs. A neurologic examination and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan reveal injury of the cauda equina. Which of the following is most likely damaged.
exp: The cauda equina is the collection of dorsal and ventral roots of the lower lumbar and sacral spinal nerves below the spinal cord. Dorsal and ventral primary rami and dorsal roots of the thoracic spinal nerves and lumbar spinal nerves do not paicipate in the formation of the cauda equina
opc: Dorsal roots of the thoracic spinal nerves
opd: Ventral roots of the sacral spinal nerves

question: Maximum Flexion in Thoracic Veebrae occurs at
exp: Maximum Thoracic flexion occurs in the lower Thoracic spine because the veebrae sta to orient their facets similar to the Lumbar Spine where the most flexion and extension occurs. Also, the Lower thoracic spine is not as cemented in place by the floating ribs

question: A crush injury of the veebral column can cause the spinal cord to swell. Which structure would be trapped between the dura and the veebral body by the swelling of spinal cord?
exp: The Posterior Longitudinal Ligament interconnects the veebral bodies and interveebral disks posteriorly and runs anterior to the spinal cord within the veebral canal. The Ligamentum Nuchae is formed by supraspinous ligaments that extend from the seventh cervical veebra to the external occipital protuberance and crest. The Anterior Longitudinal Ligament runs anterior to the veebral bodies. The Alar and Cruciform Ligaments also lie anterior to the spinal cord. fig:- veebral column and ligaments

question: A 42-year-old woman with metastatic breast cancer is known to have tumors in the interveebral foramina between the fouh and fifth cervical veebrae and between the fouh and fifth thoracic veebrae. Which of the following spinal nerves may be damaged?,
exp: All Cervical spinal nerves exit through the interveebral foramina above the corresponding veebrae, except the eighth cervical nerves, which run inferior to the seventh cervical veebra. All other spinal nerves exit the interveebral foramina below the corresponding veebrae. Therefore, the fifth cervical nerve passes between the fouh and fifth cervical veebrae, and the fouh thoracic nerve runs between the fouh and fifth thoracic veebrae.
opa: Fouh cervical and fouh thoracic nerves
opb: Fifth cervical and fifth thoracic nerves
opc: Fouh cervical and fifth thoracic nerves
opd: Fifth cervical and fouh thoracic nerves

question: During an outbreak of meningitis at a local college, a 20-year-old student presents to a hospital emergency depament complaining of headache, fever, chills, and stiff neck. On examination, it appears that he may have meningitis and needs a lumbar puncture or a spinal tap. Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) is normally withdrawn from which of the following spaces?,
exp: Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) is found in the subarachnoid space, which is a wide interval between the arachnoid layer and the pia mater. The epidural space contains the internal veebral venous plexus and epidural fat. The subdural space between the arachnoid and the dura contains a little fluid to moisten the meningeal surface. The pia mater closely covers the spinal cord and enmeshes blood vessels on the surfaces of the spinal cord.
opc: Space between the spinal cord and the pia mater

question: A 24-year-old woman comes to a hospital to deliver her baby. Her obstetrician uses a caudal anesthesia during labor and childbih to block the spinal nerves in the Epidural space. Local anesthetic agents are most likely injected which of the following openings?
exp: Caudal (epidural) anesthesia is used to block the spinal nerves in the epidural space by injecting local anesthetic agents the sacral hiatus located between the sacral cornua. An interveebral foramen transmits the dorsal and ventral primary rami of the spinal nerves. The veebral canal accommodates the spinal cord. Dorsal and ventral sacral foramina transmit the dorsal and ventral primary rami of the sacral nerves.

question: Number of veebrae in veebral column
exp: There are total thiy-three veebrae, upper twenty-four are aiculating and separated from each other by interveebral discs, seven cervical veebrae, twelve thoracic veebrae and five lumbar veebrae. The lower nine are fused, five in the sacrum and four in the coccyx.

question: Which cervical veebra has lateral mass:
exp: Lateral masses are the most bulky and solid pas of the atlas, in order to suppo the weight of the head. Each carry two aicular facets, a superior and an inferior. fig:- atlas C1

question: A 26-year-old heavyweight boxer was punched on his mandible, resulting in a slight subluxation (dislocation) of the atlantoaxial joint. The consequence of the injury was decreased range of motion at that joint. What movement would be most affected?,
exp: The atlantoaxial joints are synol joints that consist of two plane joints and one pivot joint and are involved primarily in rotation of the head. Other movements do not occur at this joint.

question: A 27-year-old mountain climber falls from a steep rock wall and is brought to the emergency depament. His physical examination and computed tomography (CT) scan reveal dislocation fracture of the upper thoracic veebrae. The fractured body of the T4 veebra aiculates with which of the following pas of the ribs
exp: The body of veebra T4 aiculates with the heads of the fouh and fifth ribs. The body of the T3 veebra aiculates with the head of the third and fouh ribs. The neck of a rib does not aiculate with any pa of the veebra. The transverse process of the veebra aiculates with the tubercle of the corresponding rib. Therefore, the transverse process of veebra T4 aiculates with the tubercle of the fouh rib.

question: Which veebral segment is numerically most constant?
exp: The number of veebrae in a region can vary but overall the number remains the same. The number of those in the cervical region however is only rarely changed.

question: The tooth like structure of C2 veebra that forms Pivot Joint with C1 veebra is called as odontoint. The other name is?
exp: The projecting tooth like structure is called as dens. Condyl is a rounded structure at the extremity of the bones and matrix is a binding structure in which binds all the organic structures.

question: Arrange the following structures in the order they are pierced during lumbar puncture. (SEQUENTIAL ARRANGEMENT) a). Epidural space b). Interspinous ligament c). Supraspinous liament d). Ligamentum flavum e). Subarachnoid space
exp: Lumbar puncture in adult: Pt lying on side with maximally flexed spine A line taken between highest points of axis at L4 level Skin cleaned & anesthetised Spinal needle inseed between L4 - L5 veebrae Structures pierced: skin, fat, supraspinous & interspinous ligaments, ligamentum flavum, epidural space, dura, arachnoid, subarachnoid space. CSF

question: Burning sensation in little toe at lateral margin ankle reflex is weak slip disc?
exp: HERNIATED DISC B/W COMPRESSED NERVE ROOT DERMATOME AFFECTED MUSCLES AFFECTED MOVEMENT WEAKNESS NERVE AND REFLEX INVOLVED L5 and S1 S1 S1 heel little toe gastrocnemius soleus plantar flexion of ankle (patient cannot stand on toes) flexion of toes tibial nerve | ankle jerk

question: A 37-year-old man is brought to the emergency depament with a Neck injury on X ray film it is diagnosed as crushed C2 veebrae. Which of the following structures would be intact after the accident?
exp: The rectus capitis posterior minor remains intact because it is not associated with C2 veebrae. It arises from the posterior tubercle of the (atlas) C1 and inses on the occipital bone below the inferior nuchal line. Other structures are associated with C2.

question: The total number of ligamentum denticulatum lying on both the sides of spinal cord are
exp: Ligamentum Denticulatum are usually 21 processes on each side and hence a total of 40-42 on both sides. It helps to anchor the spinal cord in the middle of the subarachnoid space. They first crosses behind the veebral aery where it is attached to the dura mater, and is separated by the aery from the first cervical ventral root.

question: A 69-year-old man has an abnormally Increased Curvature of the Thoracic Veebral Column. Which of the following conditions is the most likely diagnosis?
exp: Kyphosis (hunchback or humpback) is an abnormally increased Thoracic Curvature, usually resulting from osteoporosis. Lordosis is an abnormal accentuation of the Lumbar Curvature. Spina bifida occulta is failure of the veebral arch to fuse (only bony defect). Meningocele is a protrusion of the meninges through the unfused arch of the veebra, whereas meningomyelocele is a protrusion of the spinal cord and the meninges.

question: Disc herniation between L4 and L5 involves nerve root?
exp: Herniated disc involves nerve root of corresponding lower veebral level. Herniated disc between Compressed nerve root C4 and C5 C5 C5 and C6 C6 C6 and C7 C7 L3 and L4 L4 L4 and L5 L5 L5 and S1 S1

question: Not a boundary of Triangle of Auscultation:
exp: Serratus anterior is inseed on the medial border of scapula but lies anterior to scapula. Hence, it is not in the triangle of auscultation. Triangle of Auscultation is bounded by 2 muscles and scapula. Superiorly - Trapezius, Inferiorly - Latissimus dorsi and Laterally - medial wall of Scapula. Rib 7 and Rhomboideus major lie in the floor of the triangle. Since minimal muscle fibers lie over the triangle, auscultation by stethoscope is better over this triangle, especially, the sounds of swallowed fluids. Cardiac end of the stomach lies deep to this triangle.

question: Transverse ligament of atlas is pa of:
exp: Transverse ligament forms the horizontal pa of cruciform ligament.

question: Following are the various structures related to spinal cord and their respective terminal extent. Choose the wrong pair::
exp: Filum terminale is made up of collagen fibres connecting tip of spinal cord with coccyx Pial pa presents above S2, longer, covered by piamater Dural pa present below S2, shoer, covered by both pia and duramater Termination of subarchanoid space is at lower border of S2 veebrae

question: In a freak hunting accident, a 17-year-old boy was shot with an arrow that penetrated into his Suboccipital Triangle, injuring the Suboccipital Nerve between the Veebral Aery and the Posterior Arch of the Atlas. Which of the following muscles would be unaffected by such a Lesion?
exp: The splenius capitis is innervated by dorsal primary rami of the middle and lower cervical nerves. The suboccipital nerve (dorsal primary ramus of C1) supplies the muscles of the suboccipital area, including the rectus capitis posterior major, obliquus capitis superior and inferior, and the semispinalis capitis. Note Rectus capitis posterior minor remains intact because it is not associated with C2 veebrae fracture

question: A 27 yr old worker fall from a roof and is brought to the emergency depament. His physical examination and computed tomography (CT) scan reveal dislocation fracture of the thoracic veebrae. The fractured body of the T7 veebra aiculates with which of the following pas of the ribs?
exp: The body of veebra T7 aiculates with the head of the seventh and eighth ribs. The neck of a rib does not aiculate with any pas of the veebra. The transverse process of the veebra aiculates with the tubercle of the corresponding rib.
